page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Situated south of the Skelmersdale New Town the area, in the past was mainly rural with two Brickworks and several small coal mines with the Wigan to Liverpool Railway running through the centre. It consisted of 3 villages - Digmoor, Holland Moor and Crawford - administered by the Up Holland U.D.C. Today, still largely rural, Holland Moor and Digmoor have become densely populated areas of the New Town with an Industrial Area attached. All the mines are closed but one Brickworks remains open with imported clay. The Railway with its station, Up Holland, still operates but is supplemented by the M58 Motorway linking the M6 with the docks (container) at Bootle. The New Town area, hit by recession, has very high unemployment. The rest is good farmland, farmed profitably. West Lancashire D.C. is the local authority.
